location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 11: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: This letter concerns a steam engine which has been received from England and placed under James Dow's charge. Dow informs Francis Warden that the steam engine, which is intended for His Royal Highness, the Prince Royal of Persia, has been safely landed at Bushire, in twelve packages, and that an application has been made to His Majesty's Chargé d’Affaires, Henry Willock, regarding its conveyance to the interior.
